author: thezim
body:
I found several cmdlets will verify the existence of an item and ignore the WhatIf. If it doesn't exist an exception is returned. Having to wrap Copy-Item in a ShouldProcess seems redundant for that case.

Was this a design choice? Is WhatIf the equivalent to what it could have actually completed sucessfully?

Note that this occurs in Windows PowerShell as well.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Copy-Item -Path /tmp/doesnotexist.txt -Destination /somepath -WhatIf
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
What if: Performing the operation "Copy Directory" on target "Item: /tmp/doesnotexist.txt Destination: /somepath".
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Copy-Item : Cannot find path '/tmp/doesnotexist.txt' because it does not exist.
At line:1 char:1
+ Copy-Item -Path /tmp/doesnotexist.txt -Destination /somepath -WhatIf
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (/tmp/doesnotexist.txt:String) [Copy-Item], ItemNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.CopyItemCommand
```

Environment data
----------------
```powershell
Name                           Value                                                                                               
----                           -----                                                                                               
PSVersion                      6.0.1                                                                                               
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1                                                                                              
OS                             Darwin 17.4.0 Darwin Kernel Version 17.4.0: Sun Dec 17 09:19:54 PST 2017; root:xnu-4570.41.2~1/RE...
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                             
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                 
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                             
WSManStackVersion              3.0 
```

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body:
Copy-Item -WhatIf has to look at the source items so it can tell you what will be copied. Consider
`Copy-Item -whatif foo/*.txt bar`
This command will tell you all of the files in directory foo that will be copied into bar. It has to look to know what will be copied. If the source item doesn't exist, do you really want whatif to tell you that it will be copied even though it won't?

comments.author: thezim
comments.body: I’m my use case I have to create a set of dynamically folders names for a build script and work with them so it made sense. Youre explanation makes perfect sense. I’ll works around it with  shouldprocess. Thanks.

title: WhatIf should not very input items.
